attributes.action: SDR operation to be made available on the NHS for all children who need it.
attributes.background: Tommie was born at 30 weeks, and suffers with cerebral palsy  recently he was assed by a team at great Ormond street and was told he was eligible for an SDR op which is his only chance at walking independently however NHS wont fund it meaning its down to family/friends to find £25,000.00
attributes.additional_details: To get out of his wheel chair , Tommie needs to raise £25,000.00 shockingly other families have had to raise much more to help there children walk.

attributes.action: Flash glucose monitoring systems to be available on the NHS.
attributes.background:
Flash glucose monitoring system the next best thing to a cgm. 
Flash Glucose Monitoring is a much cheaper and alternative way to check your sugars, insert a sensor into the arm/leg and scan away why prick when you can scan.
attributes.additional_details:
The system does not require fingerstick calibration, so users can dose insulin based on its readings (except for when hypoglycemic, when glucose levels are rapidly changing, or when symptoms don’t match the system’s readings). 

The sensor can be worn for 14 days at a time, and has shown better control and much cheaper then testing with strips.

attributes.action: The BBC board of governors should not be appointed by HM Government.
attributes.background: The BBC board of governors should be independently selected, and not be associated to any political organisation. If the government of the day appoint the board of governors, there is risk of political bias in reporting, damaging to a strong democracy within these isles.

attributes.action: Give the people of Wales a referendum on independence
attributes.background:
Give the people of Wales a referendum on Welsh independence.

Cynnal refferendwm ar annibyniaeth Cymru.

attributes.action: Cut the NHS waiting list for military children when moving.
attributes.background:
My husband is in the military and we found out 2/3 of our children have SEN meaning they need services provided by NHS.

 we waited over a year for services, we finally get seen to then only get posted. We find out this means we go to the bottom of any list! Starting the process all over again.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm calling on the government to bring in a legislation that serving millitary families do NOT go to the bottom of the NHS waiting lists when they move. 
by the time you get the service you NEED you then get a posting order to only start the process again, meaning your at the bottom of the list! Meanwhile it has had a detremental effect in their development.

put something into place to protect them.  Our families already sacrifice so much, yet recive no support in this matter which is needed.

attributes.action: make it legal requirement for public broadcasters to show disabled sports on TV
attributes.background: When London won the right to bid the 2012 summer olympics and Paralympics the slogan for the game was launched 'Inspire a Generation' But sadly what seems to have been forgotten is that the olympics and Paralympics only come around every four years and for the matter of a very short time.

attributes.action: Reduce the age limit on breast cancer screening to 40.
attributes.background: too many friends gone through cancer at 40 and they didn't even know they had it.

attributes.action: Stop Evelyn Woods being deported I
attributes.background: Evelyn Woods has lived in Medway 50+ years. Evelyn has had her 3 children born here(unfortunately one past away in 2003) was married and widowed here. This problem came to light when Evelyn got a job,after 3 months was told she couldn't work here and was facing deportation.
attributes.additional_details: Kent online have recently interviews Evelyn and Kelly Tolhurst Mp has been liasioning with the home office.

attributes.action: Mandatory whole life sentence for anyone convicted of murdering a child.
attributes.background: Anyone convicted of murdering a child should spend the rest of there life in prison, without the possibility of parole, the recent case involving Kathryn Smith, highlights how pathetic sentencing for these types of crime has become..
attributes.additional_details: As a parent I feel this Country needs tougher sentencing when it come to crimes against children..

attributes.action: Introduce new traffic legislation to benefit motorbikes and emergency services.
attributes.background: Make it law that road users must move to the nearside in a traffic jam or when the traffic is stationery/slow moving, on multi lanes inner lanes move to the nearside and the outer lane move to the offside.   Allowing motorbikes and emergency services to filter/continue without risk of accident.
attributes.additional_details:
I am a motorbike rider of many years with an advanced riding certificate and a member of Blood bike Wales.  With more traffic users on the roads each year.  I find there to be the downturn/deterioration of courtesy and common sense within road users, more and more road users do not give way and sadly selfishly blocks the way of motorbike users during slow moving or stationary traffic.  

This would  increase safe passage for motorbikes and emergency services without affecting the road user!

attributes.action: Hold another UK EU referendum in which UK residents can vote alongside Brits
attributes.background: The results of the UK EU referendum does not accurately reflect the wishes of the country and that is because UK residents were not granted a vote.  UK residents deserve to have a voice in the future of their country.
attributes.additional_details:
The Office for National Statistics (ONS) Labour Force Survey estimated in 2015, there are 3.3 million EU citizens residing in the UK.

UK residents have been calling this country home for years.  They work here, pay taxes, have had children here, own property and yet they didn't have a say in the future of what is also their country.  

A new referendum must be held to include their voice.

attributes.action: Stop trading & supporting India until it stops human rights violation in Kashmir
attributes.background: Draconian laws such as AFSPA & PSA are used by India to commit human rights violations in Kashmir with impunity, over last 44 days of worst curfew imposed in Kashmir, Indian forces have killed over 70+ civilians, 200+ blinded using pellets, including young kids as young as 1 year, injured 8000+.
attributes.additional_details:
Insha, 14 year old is battling for her life due to serious brain injury after been hit by pellets aimed deliberately at upper body.

Essentials supplies like food, water & medicine have been curtailed, communication restricted, an ambulance driver shot while transporting patient to hospital, Lecturer dragged from home and beaten to death. 

We people of Britain have an obligation to put an end to these human rights violations.

attributes.action: Reinstate maintenance grants for English Students in line with rest of UK.
attributes.background:
On checking the Student Finance England details for our daughter - it became apparent that, as we reside in England - we are disproportionately disadvantaged in terms of government support for further education. 
There are no longer non repayable grants available to English residents.
attributes.additional_details:
If you live in Scotland, Ireland or Wales you are entitled to non repayable grants towards your university fees and living costs, in addition to your loans. On a 3 year degree, an English student will be charged £9k study fees and 'may' be eligible for a loan of up to £6905 for living expenses/year - all of which is repayable! 
If you live elsewhere in the uk - you are eligible to receive non-repayable grants in excess of £5000/yr. 
Over a 3yr course this reduces debt by over £15000! Fair?

attributes.action: Visa Settlement Fees to be ABOLISH
attributes.background: Why UK embassies are discriminated Settled people and British citizens' family member with an extremely expensive Visa Settlement Fees while they are living and paying tax as everyone.

attributes.action: Review Her Majesty’s Revenue and Customs Widening Access claim process.
attributes.background: 1000's of NHS Professionals have been waiting for over a year for the HMRC to process refund claims. The HMRC should be set specific timeframes to process claims. There is evidence of inconsistent information being given by the HMRC to claimants and this is totally unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
Her Majesty’s Revenue and Customs (HMRC) has stated that NHS employed staff also in full-time education are exempt from Tax and NI up to an annual allowance on earnings of £15,480, whilst in training, provided they meet certain criteria. Claims for refunds of tax and NI can be made for the period September 1999 to March 2013. 

This process has not been advertised to NHS professionals. The HMRC has made and error collecting Tax/NI and should rightfully correct this with complete transparency.

attributes.action: Reinstate the Eighty Five Percentile Rule for setting speed limits.
attributes.background: We used to set speed limits scientifically and sensibly instead of on a totally arbitrary, Nimbyist, green political, subjective basis that we use now. In those days the strap line 'It's a limit for a reason' did have some merit. Now such claims are totally false.
attributes.additional_details:
The abandonment of a scientific method has resulted in blanket speed limit areas where accidents are not happening, speed limits set to please minority local interests, the over-slowing of crucial infrastructure, the prosecution of many perfectly safe drivers by virtue of arbitrary speed limits and a profitable Speeding Industry.  

An arbitrary order: http://driveeastmidlands.blogspot.co.uk/2015/06/and-here-is-basis-of-high-earning.html 

Speed Limit Submission: http://bit.ly/23zqtCC

attributes.action: Play an active role in achieving a peaceful resolution to the Kashmir dispute.
attributes.background: The Kashmir dispute has not been resolved for over 7 decades. In recent days, we have seen further Indian atrocities committed against the people of Kashmir leaving many dead. The UK government must play its role in pressuring the Indian government to halt its hostilities and to reach a resolution.
attributes.additional_details:
We petition the UK government to:

1) Pressurise the Indian government to halt its hostilities in Indian occupied Kashmir, against the people of Kashmir.

2) Play an active diplomatic role to reach a peaceful settlement of the Kashmir dispute.

3) Ensure, through diplomacy, that the UN Resolutions regarding a free and fair referendum in Kashmir are enforced. Thus, the people of Kashmir may exercise self-determination once and for all without the influence of any State in/out of the region.

attributes.action: Make First Aid training a mandatory part of the Driving Licence
attributes.background: 1780 people died in road accidents in the last 12 months, 23,700 were seriously injured. 50% of deaths occur within 4 minutes of an accident before an ambulance has arrived. Mandatory training as part of the driving test would empower more people with skills to help and save hundreds of lives.
attributes.additional_details: Switzerland, Germany, Czech Republic, Austria, Slovenia, Hungary and the Baltic States all have mandatory First Aid training as part of their Driving Test and consequently have many more people skilled to help in an emergency. This in turn makes roads safer and empowers more people to be able to administer First Aid generally. In a recent survey from SJA 59% of people in the UK would not know what to do in an emergency, this is a sensible way forward.

attributes.action: To fund research for hidradenitis suppurativa  (HS) to get the knowledge to GP's
attributes.background: I have HS as do many of us here in the UK. HS is a painful skin disease thats courses boil like abscesses that affect the armpit, breast, groin and pubic area. It can effect people mentally as well as physically, like many ive had time of work due to the pain and after having surgery.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered with this diseases for the past 5 to 6 year and havent got any closer to any kind of relief from the pain the past year i have had 4 operations and now the surgeon's will not see me until i have seen the dermatologist, its a daily battle with my pain. Im not the only one that suffers on a daily basis with the pain and embarrassment of this dreadful disease. We need to see more support for people suffering and GP's and other professionals getting the knowledge to help us.

attributes.action: Integrate economics and politics classes into the National Curriculum
attributes.background: The reaction of many regretful voters on social media to the post-publication by tabloids of the effects of a 'leave' vote following the EU referendum underlines the need for students of all backgrounds to receive an unbiased but informed education on the important subjects of politics and economics
attributes.additional_details: Please don't let voters continue to engage in guesswork or be swayed by hysteria or bad politics when it comes to their voting preferences. Give our future generations the opportunity to learn about the intricacies of politics, what the major political parties stand for through examination of their manifestos. Show them that these manifestos are rarely manifested. Show them that politics is fraught with lies and, more importantly, how to wade through these lies and make an informed choice.

attributes.action: Turn Luton into the cannabis capital of the world.
attributes.background: Cannabis, hardly even worth being called a drug. Its ridiculous to find that possesion of a plant can land you jail time or at least a trip to the police station. My proposition is that we turn Luton into a city similar to Amsterdam while keeping the drug illegal for sale in the rest of the country.
attributes.additional_details: This was we can use the huge amounts of profits we will see from Luton to further benefit our poorer parts of the country. Rest assured that the majority of people will still be able to stay away from the drug as it would be confined to coffee shops in Luton. This will be a haven for pot smokers knowing that our government is keeping up with the times and wont have to travel to another country to better their economy with our hard earned cash. A big tourist market for a city with an airport.

attributes.action: Make All Ministers Publish Their Tax Returns
attributes.background: In an interview today the Leader of the Opposition Jeremy Corbyn stated "The public need to have confidence that their representatives in Parliament... are getting their income from honest and open sources".
attributes.additional_details:
The British public deserve to know whether their representatives in  government are matching words with personal action and taking individual responsibility with their finances.

Sign this petition to secure a greater level of transparency and promote the ethical accountability of government ministers.

attributes.action: stop DLA refusing rare disabilities! I.e Perthes Disease
attributes.background: Perthes disease, AKA Legg-Calvé- Perthes is a childhood condition affecting the head of femur in the hip joint & can sometimes cause mobility problems in later life necessitating a Total Hip Replacement. Symptoms include a limp occasional leg length discrepancy & pain in the hip especially at night.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the children are in pain almost every day & some are in casts or they may need surgery involving cutting through the thigh bone and re-angling the bone so that the head sits properly in the socket pinning and plating it.In place ago help the head grow to the correct shape. I am disgusted to hear so many stories of DLA/PIP refusing to recognise this as a disability and turning down children in wheelchairs! This can happen not just once but 4-5 times per child. THIS IS A DISGRACE. Do your research DLA!!

attributes.action: Child Benefit to be taxed based on household income and not one parents salary
attributes.background: Currently if a single person earns over £50k a year they have to pay a tax charge on child benefit, earn over £60k and you have to pay more tax than child benefit so there is no point in claiming. However a couple can have a joint income of £98k (£49k each) and receive the full Child Benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
I feel very strongly about this and the difference in receiving or not receiving Child Benefit may influence financial decisions for many families.

Child Benefit is £20.70 per week for one child and £13.79 for an additional child. For some families this makes a huge difference. 

Why should families with a household income of less than £98k receive their full entitlement to Child Benefit and yet a family with one working parent who earns over £48k not?

attributes.action: Scrap land factor maintenance arrangements by companies on housing estates.
attributes.background: New estates are burdened with extra maintenance charges from private companies. The industry is unregulated, uncontrolled and monopolised in such a manner that unfairly disadvantages residents
attributes.additional_details:
There are hundreds of new build estates across the UK that are burdened with extra charges to resident for the maintenance of the open shared spaces on their estates. The residents have no choice in which company carries out the work. The charges are over inflated, the quality of work is substandard and companies bully residents into continued payments with threats of legal action. 
There seems to be no clear way of complaint, and no independent way of arbitration or enforcement of standards.

attributes.action: Rename Manchester Victoria railway station Manchester Victoria Wood station.
attributes.background: Victoria Wood was a much loved comedian born and raised in Manchester. Her humour was distinctive to the city and she set her TV series 'Dinner Ladies' there. Following her death in 2016, Manchester Victoria railway station was renamed in her honour for an hour. It should be renamed permanently.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/whats-on/whats-on-news/victoria-station-become-victoria-wood-11404138

attributes.action: Provide immediately  £1.5m to replace Deerness Bridge on C18 in County Durham
attributes.background:
This bridge is a vital semi rural link for families and businesses in County Durham. It is now unsafe for use as the replacement of this 114 year old bridge was hindered by County Durham Councils lack of strategy and funding
These lack of funds will delay replacement by more than 1 year by DCC
attributes.additional_details:
http://m.durhamadvertiser.co.uk/news/14501015.Anger_over_one_way_system_following_closure_of_Deerness_Bridge/?ref=rss&utm_source=dlvr.it&utm_medium=facebook

Facebook page : Deerness Bridge action group

attributes.action: Make all voting in PEN only
attributes.background: Due to the amount of vote rigging that takes place and petitions silenced, we the people of the UK only demand ALL voting from now will be in PEN only .There has never been a lawful reason not too and voting in pencil has never been justified.
attributes.additional_details: People of the UK are tired and hurt because of the no confidence and lack of support we get from current leaders.Time for change.

attributes.action: An URGENT review of the rates Local Authorities pay for adult residential care.
attributes.background: Adult social care is severely under funded. Local authority net spending on social care has dropped by an average of 2.2% a year since 2009 despite day to day living costs increasing. The rates provided to operators to care for LA funded residents are woefully inadequate & many homes risk closure.
attributes.additional_details:
This recent BBC report shows that 5000 care homes in the UK are now on the brink of closure. 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36200855

Whilst councils are undoubtedly under extreme financial pressure, in failing to keep up with the rising costs of care, they are putting businesses, jobs & the lives of the UK's most vulnerable residents at risk!

We therefore ask you to review the rates paid by local authorities for adult residential care in the UK as a matter of urgency, before it is too late!

attributes.action: Refine the ATC radio traffic act to allow UK listening
attributes.background:
Refine the ATC radio traffic act to allow UK listening
Current law states you can only listen to transmissions meant for general reception. This means the general public can not listen to ATC traffic in the UK (but can listen to ATC in the US!).
attributes.additional_details:
A licence is not required for a radio receiver as long as it is not capable of transmission as well (The Wireless Telegraphy Apparatus (Receivers) (Exemption) Regulations 1989 (SI 1989 No 123).

Although it is not illegal to sell, buy or own a scanning or other receiver in the UK, it must only be used to listen to transmissions meant for GENERAL RECEPTION. 
It is an offence to listen to any other radio services unless you are authorised by a designated person to do so.

attributes.action: Delay invoking Article 50 until Expert Commission reviews impact of Brexit on UK
attributes.background: MPs should respect the wishes of the 63% of the electorate who did not vote to leave the EU, and demand that Article 50 not be invoked until Brexit proponents provide a fully developed plan for the process of leaving the EU, followed by an Expert Commission to assess its economic and social impact.
attributes.additional_details: "Leave campaign" MPs claimed that leaving the EU would mean: more money for the NHS; improved job prospects for UK residents through lower immigration; greater economic prosperity through reduced red-tape and renegotiated trading agreements with the EU and the rest of the world. Since the Referendum, these claims have been significantly reduced, and there is no Brexit plan. Parliament now needs to take responsibility to ensure that the outcome is as beneficial as possible for the British people.

attributes.action: Reveal how many detainees reported being sexually assaulted/raped in Yarl’s Wood
attributes.background: In response to a Freedom of Information request, The Home Office refused to reveal how many detainees have been sexually assaulted or raped inside Yarl’s Wood on the grounds that “disclosure would, or would be likely to, prejudice the commercial interests” of people involved with running Yarl’s Wood
attributes.additional_details:
The Independent submitted the FOI because many reports of sexual assault & abuse have been made against staff at Yarl’s Wood. Chief prisons inspector Nick Hardwick called the centre  a “place of national concern”. The UN’s special rapporteur on violence against women, Rashida Manjoo said she'd been refused entry to the centre by the Government
The Immigration Minister & Home Secretary must reveal the numbers, & stop putting the commercial interests of Serco above human rights of vulnerable people

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for CCTV to be installed in all slaughterhouses
attributes.background: I am disgusted by the increase in animal abuse reported in the United Kingdom in slaughter houses. From malpractice to sheet cruelty we need to find a way to ensure that these awful people can be punished. this would be a fantastic step forward in step changing animal welfare in this country.

attributes.action: Schools to consider needs of all pupils when addressing attendance & behaviour
attributes.background:
The Department for Education and Nick Gibb released this publication on 24th March 2016. https://www.gov.uk/government/news/just-one-day-off-can-hamper-childrens-life-chances.
The content of this publication is concerning for pupils and their parents. It ignores individual needs and circumstances.
attributes.additional_details:
What if money was spent on finding ways to help students with challenges rather than simply thinking up more punitive strategies (as if schools don't already use enough of these already)?

We supposedly live in a society where respect, patience, tolerance and cooperation are all values very much embraced (and taught in schools).

Many children have been out of school and receiving minimal education for a long time through no fault of their own or their parents. Families need help, not punishment

attributes.action: Parents must be allowed access to their children unless a court rules otherwise.
attributes.background:
This petition is asking for it to be made illegal for one parent to deny the other access, without them being ruled as unfit by a court. 
 
 This petition is designed to protect children from the emotional damage that occurs when parents use them as a weapon against each other.
attributes.additional_details: Local authorities can't make one parent allow the other access. The time it takes for one parent to regain access via the courts can leave lasting damage between a parent and child, who have then lost valuable time during crucial developmental stages, which can never be reclaimed. Unless there is good reason, such as the police suspecting physical abuse, then contact should not be denied, and the local authorities should have the power to ensure access is arranged by law, even if it's supervised

attributes.action: Change the law so the councils must scan all dead pets for a microchip.
attributes.background:
Most people assume their cat would be scanned if found dead and collected by the council, and that they would be informed, but this is simply not the case. 

When a cat gets killed in a traffic accident, the councils have no legal obligation to scan for a microchip. This need to change.
attributes.additional_details:
The scanners are relatively cheap (£40) and all councils have them already to scan the stray dogs, since they are obliged to do that.

The change in law will be easy and inexpensive to implement. 
It will also save a lot of pet owners from the pain of not knowing what happened to their beloved pets.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell petrol/diesel engine cars in the UK from 2025
attributes.background:
This is already law in Holland and UK needs to follow ASAP
So only Electric Cars would be available for sale from that date.

attributes.action: Bring the RAF and Navy Tattoo policy in line with the revised Army policy.
attributes.background: The British Army on 1 August 2014 brought in a revised Tattoo policy which allows for body art to be displayed on hands and rear of the neck.  The Army and Capita, who assisted with the revised policy, agree that tattoos do not inhibit operational functionality or compromise the Army's image.
attributes.additional_details:
New MoD figures show the three services are short of nearly 6,400 trained personnel, more than 4,000 of them soldiers.
Year 13/14 The Army rejected 336 applications because of offensive or inappropriately placed tattoos, as well as piercings.
Elizabeth Lee from Capita said: 'Tattoos have become increasingly acceptable and common in society, including among potential recruits considering a career in the Army. 'Greater flexibility over tattoos on the neck or hands will remove a barrier for a number of people currently interested in applying for a job in the Army, without compromising its image as a professional force.'

attributes.action: Reconsideration of Eric Pickles' decision in 2014 to approve a SRFI in St Albans
attributes.background: In light of Greg Clark's decision in July 2016 dismissing an appeal to build a International Freight Exchange on green belt in Colnbrook, we ask the new SOS for Communities and Local Government to use Greg Clark's criteria to overturn approval for a Strategic Rail Freight Interchange in St Albans.
attributes.additional_details: After the SOS twice refused planning permission for a SRFI development on 300 acres of green belt in St Albans, Hertfordshire, Eric Pickles changed his mind and approved it in July 2014 without allowing a conjoined enquiry with Colnbrook. Greg Clark in turning down the Colnbrook development concluded "that the benefits of the scheme do not clearly overcome the harm. Consequently very special circumstances do not exist to justify the development."(on green belt)

attributes.action: Create a specific offence to protect Nurses, Paramedics & Medical volunteers.
attributes.background:
This offence should be created to enable prosecution for anyone who assaults Medical Staff. This offence can be committed anywhere medical personnel are working. This must be extended to not only to NHS trusts, but also voluntary organisations and private providers.

Medical Staff are life-savers
attributes.additional_details:
Paramedics have threatened with death, spat at, kicked, punched and had knives pulled on them as they answer emergency calls.

Ambulance trust’s are now calling on magistrates to get tough with offenders convicted of assaulting 999 teams, to protect frontline medics from violence and abuse.

There is no deterrent. If people knew they would get a guaranteed prison sentence for attacking medical staff, they would probably think twice about doing it.

attributes.action: Require Coroners, in suicide cases, to explore if best practice was followed.
attributes.background: Worldwide studies show that the involvement of family, friends & carers helps to reduce suicide. The document, http://bit.ly/1VUKDI5, agreed by all the professional bodies, advocates that unless there are good reasons not to do so, consent should always be sought to involve family, friends & carers.
attributes.additional_details: Rebecca Kelsall, see http://dailym.ai/1UWGJNx, died because GPs failed to follow RCGP guidelines CR152 and the NICE guidelines CG90 and CG91. This showed that the health service can be slow in keeping abreast with latest guidelines. As coroners have a duty to investigate whether death was avoidable, they are best placed to monitor whether best practice guidelines are followed.  As such, coroners should persistently ask clinicians and others for reports about processes and procedures followed.

attributes.action: Demand MPs to hold an anonymous poll on the EU Referendum (Stay/Leave)
attributes.background: MPs need to have their say on the EU Referendum led by their conscience to do the best for Britain. First, it is better to hold an anonymous poll so that MPs are not influenced by career ambitions of being re-elected (support their electoral area outcome even if they are fundamentally against it).
attributes.additional_details:
The EU Referendum had an advisory role. The outcome was compromised by misleading information from the Leave campaign, topics included: NHS, immigration, free movement and the cost of the UK’s EU membership. Millions of people didn't know what they voted for. 
This anonymous poll is designed to help MPs understand where they stand and proceed accordingly as the period of uncertainty is unquestionably bad for the economy.
MPs are required to vote in Britain's best interest by law.

attributes.action: Please make it LAW to Scan all animals on a regular basis at the vets
attributes.background:
Currently in the UK they're are no laws with dogs/cats/animals getting scanned on a regular basis when they visit the vets. 
There is very sadly a big problem in the UK with dogs/cats getting stolen or going missing. Please Sign & Share to help this happen. 
Shocking that it is not law already.
attributes.additional_details:
All vets need to scan on new appointments, and scan on a regular basis. The Microchip can also disappear or move.
Some people find them and do not hand them in to the right authorities(dog warden etc) like it is law to do. 
My personal experience in the past each time my dogs have been scanned I have had to request it. This should not be the case.
Luckily I did that, as if my dog did go missing I would of never of got him back as his chip vanished. Dogs have a chip for a REASON
Dogs' are Family

attributes.action: British servicemen and women to have legal immunity from prosecution
attributes.background: Financial interests have caused accusations too be made too Service Persons for doing their duty, by order, refusal could mean Mutiny or Treason
attributes.additional_details:
Many enemies use Children and Women as a fire wall, making a problem for every commander, but the active service person should never be held responsible for collateral, nor for that (Drone Pilots)
No service person doing his duty in a war or warlike situation should ever be criminalised for serving His or Her, Queen, Her Country, and Subjects. Ireland, Irak, Afgahnistan  are examples of what can happen.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for doctors to send males letters about a PSA BLOOD TEST
attributes.background: I want action as i find women get reminders to have regular smear tests done but males who are reaching the age of 50 have to ask to have a psa test done to check for prostate cancer and not alot of men know about this test

attributes.action: Prevent any Council setting up charges for Park Run or any similar event.
attributes.background: Little Stoke Parish Council have begun to charge runners £1 to participate in its local Park Run. An event which helps and encourages people to get out and run or walk 5km once a week.
attributes.additional_details: Park Run is a free global organised run and should be kept that way.

attributes.action: Regulate Private Hire Fares
attributes.background: To regulate Private hire fares to minimum wage. To make sure that all operators follow them correctly.

attributes.action: Get Pam Carlson's Deportation OVERTURNED!
attributes.background: Pam has lived in the UK for 7 YEARS, she came over on a Domestic Visa, but split from her long term partner, therefore being deported. She works, lives and contributes to this country as well as being an avid fund raiser for animal charities. She does nothing but GIVE, never taken a penny from theUK
attributes.additional_details: What more information do you need, other than she works, lives, and has a LIFE here in the UK. She fund raises, she helps others, and she is one of the nicest people anyone has ever known.

attributes.action: Discuss a northern bypass to improve traffic flow at Chichester, West Sussex.
attributes.background: The A27 is a major road connecting the towns and cities of the South Coast. At Chichester the A27 is a dual carriageway to the south which frequently becomes gridlocked. A northern bypass proposal, popular with residents, has been dropped and voting is only on the inferior southern options.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see option details and maps at
www.highways.gov.uk>roads>a27-chichester 
Please take note of the costs, the saving on journey times, environmental impact and the time taken to build the "improvements" with the subsequent traffic congestion. Although the southern options are cheaper than a northern bypass they will all be unable to cope within a few years and the whole process will begin again.
Please help our small voices be heard by joining this petition.
Many thanks for your interest.

attributes.action: Make the documents relating to David Kelly's death public
attributes.background:
David Kelly's death, a UN weapons inspector, shortly followed the WMD inspections in 2003. In 2010, the government deemed the circumstances around his death 'should be kept secret' for 70 years.
Following the Chilcot report today, I feel these documents should be released in the public interest.
